page.title: 06The West Wood.
page.content: This wood of 33 hectares is owned by the Church of England but it is managed by Castle Point District Council as an{open space}.The wood's voluntary warden has recently succeeded in having it designated as a {nature reserve}. The wood is not being coppiced but nesting sites are being created by providing nesting-boxes and by closing paths to reduce disturbance. This year, 1985, the warden hopes to build a pond as a fire-fighting measure. While the numbers of{jay, green {woodpecker and magpie}remain steady, few smaller birds nest because of excesive disturbance. There are several{fox-holes}and a{badger community but only{rabbits}and{grey {squirrels}are on the increase.
